cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue west-northwest across Hispaniola and the Bahamas, then bend northwest paralleling the Florida east coast toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the southeast Florida coast (near or just north of Miami–Palm Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas from Cat Island to San Salvador and Rum Cay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, entire Dominican Republic coast, north coast of Haiti east of Le Mole St-Nicholas, Turks & Caicos, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Bahamas, Florida east coast, and the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts of 40–50 mph possible as Isaias passes near the Georgia coast Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal surge of roughly 2–4 ft above normal tide levels possible for the Georgia coast, including the Port of Savannah
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could deliver 3–6 in of rainfall with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and rough seas that can disrupt vessel traffic and port operations
